post.body: yes, but when coding for FOSS I follow the main project coding standards, then it's not "my style"... cut the bull, cake kills
it's branched on github as deep_loading, not documented yet, but I'll give you a quick overview via DM
true... actually these are for the FOSS community, and not particularly for me, but feels good anyway
wow, seems thrilling!
FYI LazyLoader and Linkable are on they're own repo now, 'deep loading' is in a branch for LazyLoader. They and + will be packed soon
"oh yeah baby, now Cake is bombing buggy code!" - http://tinyurl.com/8n749d
productivity +1. It feels good, even more after a whole night awake. I think that working on personal projects makes you feel better.
hum, snitter doesn't seems to work on linux #air #linux
crappy: implemented the feature in less than 20 minutes, combining Likable and LazyLoader. Will pack them together: 2.0 here we go
... sorry, did I wrote 7? I meant 2... not even have 7 more dh related cool behaviors. Anyway sorry for all the noise
anyway, i'm struggling with this new feature on LazyLoader, and I hope to release it and 7 other buddies till 6 am
thinking on pack all my behaviors in a single release, there are lot's of things that they could do together
git is stupid with sub-repos. Any con to this assumption?
git add . && git commit -m "initial app architecture" && git push git@github.com:rafaelbandeira3/blog.git - woohooo, I'm baking man
rafaelbandeira3.wordpress.com - CakePHP 1.2 rc4 - The missing release announcement: http://snurl.com/8yoy4
as I said, I like "pinkish" desktops http://twitpic.com/uywd - yeah, it's purple, and it's mine
new cc arrived on friday, bank had missed my account on updates. Guess I was the only still using a non-GSM cc. They don't like me ;-)
trying some AIR apps on linux. Pretty good job they've done, shadows look awful though.
missing getClientUserAgent() on RequestHandler... I know there are other ways...
there are hairy lines on that code! the good about non open source sw, is that you won't dislike a "nice" app because it's code is awful...
